event.displayedsponsor: Dr. Talbot Spivak Holocaust Memorial Week Committee
event.title: Faculty Presentation - Dr. Sandi Towers-Romero
event.description:
Please join the Holocaust Memorial Committee' event via YouTube Live for a lecture presented by Dr. Sandi Towers, Professor of Law and First Year Experience, Florida SouthWestern State College titled "Krakow, Poland, and Auschwitz-Birkenau-Yesterday and Today, Seventy Five Years From Liberation."

On YouTube Live: https://youtu.be/zdUA129Adrk

event.displayedsponsor: Dr. Talbot Spivak Holocaust Memorial Week Committee
event.title: Book Discussion with Dr. Sandi Towers-Romero
event.description:
Please join the Holocaust Memorial Committee's and Legal Studies Club of FSW's event via Zoom for a book dicussion on Chapter 1 of Ladies and Gentlemen of the Jury: Greatest Closing Arguments in Modern Law titled "Architects of Genocide." Please read this chapter, available on Google Books prior to the discussion.

On Zoom: https://fsw.zoom.us/j/84243424673?pwd=ZGV3SFJpZ1NIVFE3Z3BJMDBZb2d6UT09

event.displayedsponsor: Dr. Talbot Spivak Holocaust Memorial Week Committee
event.title: Guest Lecture - Dr. Paul Barthrop
event.description:
Please join the Holocaust Memorial Committee's event via YouTube Live for a lecture presented by Dr. Paul Barthrop titled "Liberation and Reflections by Survivors of the Nazi Concentration Camps."

On YouTube Live: https://youtu.be/HVChMBWKvYw

event.displayedsponsor: Dr. Talbot Spivak Holocaust Memorial Week Committee
event.title: Guest Lecture - Bunthea Keo
event.description:
Please join the Holocaust Memorial Committee's event via YouTube Live for a lecture presented by Bunthea "Thea" Keo titled "Comparative Genocide: Cambodia & Darfur."

Bunthea "Thea" Keo is a Cambodian human rights lawyer who describes his experience as a child refugee and as a human rights officer in Darfur.

On YouTube Live: https://youtu.be/4SOvEnE35f8
